page.title: 07Scarcliffe Wood
page.content: There are one thousand acres of woodland in Scarcliffe Parish.One half was felled in 1962 and replaced with Corsican Pine.This can grow well in limestone soils and is resistant to the considerable air pollution. The Ash Tree is the stately native tree.It has a rounded crown,but the lower branches curve downwards and the tips turn upwards.The bark is grey and the winter buds are black.The compound leaves have seven pairs of oval leaflets.The purplish flowers are wind pollinated.It is a deciduous tree.Violins,chairs,axe_handles,barrel s and wooden boxes are made from Ash. The Pedunculate Oak is the most common oak.It grows to a height of thirty metres.It is recognised by long stalks on which the female flowers and acorns grow.Leaves are stemless.Buds group towards the end of the twigs.
